CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 30, 1958, pg. A22, reads: "Host Play Chef To Guests - Young Jay Robinson, son of Mr. and Mrs. James (Jimmy Joe) Robinson of 825 Clarissa St., plays chef to some of his party guests by grilling (and the word is used with tongue in cheek) some hot dogs for them during the celebration of his sixth birthday last week. Watching their host 'charcoal' the teenagers' delicacy are, left to right: Donna McMann, Carl Morris, Sammy McMann, the honoree, Linda Thornhill and Pamela Hord.  Reports are that the party was 'fine' and the food was 'swell' (mother saw to that). - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Donna McMann, Carl Morris, Sammy McMann, Jay Robinson, holding hotdog over grill, Linda Thornhill, and Pamela Hord, standing on patio of Robinson residence, 825 Clarissa Street, Upper Hill District
